oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: First-person retelling of the wounding of Pvt. John F. Blair, Co. G, 128th Inf. Regt., 32nd Div.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This handwritten document describes how Pvt. John F. Blair, Co. G, 128th Inf Regt., 32nd Div., World War, 1914-1918, was shot in the right thigh during the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. The offensive began on September 26, 1918 and lasted until the Armistice. Blair describes how he tried to seek shelter in a shell hole. He was hit and " Every thing turned darke (sic) for me." He went on to describe how parts of his equipments were damaged and that he was only hit by one piece of shrapnel.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
